advice:
Be honest. Stop the discrimination. Promote good people with good competence based on the performance instead of likeability/preference. Stop the lip service culture. Let go of all that 'handshaker's. Stop power abuse by top management. Re-organize the organization structure.
Pay more attention to all dedicated employees. Give bonus to the employees. If it is possible, don't give away the bonus to the 'external' inspectors from the ... just to get the approvals.
cons:
Discriminatory practices (those that touch the sky will get more attention). If you want to see the real condition of the workplace, look at the reviews of the ground staff.
There are also some reviews that were made-up just to enhance the rating on glassdoor.

advice: Stop the micro management. Give the BO authority to do thing.  LISTEN to feedback and be able to accept. Be open minded and transparent on the action taken. Communication within HQ and BO should be clear and include English. If you can't accept criticism/feedback, you can't be a leader.
cons: Micro Manage CEO. Direction keep changing. Change decision like flipping prata. No proper SOP. No proper guideline or training for staff. Always only think and consider from their HQ point of view, never care about other International BO feedback. No communication between HQ and BO. Mostly IOC are in Bahasa Indonesia. Not transparent in terms of guidelines and instructions. Cutting cost at the wrong department/stuff instead of cutting those staff who is not performance. Alot of favoritism in the management office. It's about who suck up to who, who know who and who like who in order to promote. Once you step on his toes, you will be in risk to be sent to some far away station or no position in HQ.  No marketing budget to do activity. Expect zero output but double input/revenue from the staff. Keeping the staff who just listen and work like a puppet and dismiss staff who can really work and give feedback. Basically horrible management.
pros: Staff travel benefit is good. It really depends on who is your direct boss and AM/DM of your BO.
summary: Travel benefit is good, others is Meh. Double standard. No proper SOP. Keep changing decision. One-way communication.

advice:
1. Please do see your Ground Employee. GIA is not only meant to be an Air Crew, if one is for all and all for one, the Management will set fair policy.
2. Business Plan and Corporate Strategy need commitment and contemplating. Hopefully, newer BoD will follow the path until they create new improvement.
3. Career path impovement and monitoring.
cons:
1. Business as Usual (BAU)
2. Lack of Leader person; Mostly Bosses are dominant
3. Lack of Training benefit; You have to do it yourself, with minimum technical assistant. Most Trainings are irrelevant with KPI objective. It feels mediocre and safe.
4. Board Of Director (BoD) fast turnover; It frustrates even more, since Airlines is unstable business.
5. Career Path is trully messed. Human Capital needs revamp. SOS!
6. Gross Salary is pity, unless you are an Air Crew, you migh have USD 5,000 in a month. Other than that, enjoy yourself in jealousy.
pros:
1. Good environment and work location
2. Average working pressure, then you will have enough times to do other businesses.
3. Flight Consession; Mostly recommended to the one who love travelling a lot, and either doing business purpose around the world
4. Medical Insurrance with decent coverage until 3 (three) children.
5. Average remuneration and benefit beside your monthly salary; it depens on your performance within year

advice: Board of Directors: Tender your resignation. You are quite useless and are pleased to be surrounded by people who suck up to you. You are too busy cooking the book than running the company.
cons:
- bureauractic
- no meritocracy
- no career path. If you want to get ahead, suck up to someone and make sure he/she is powerful enough
- a lot of inefficiencies. Hundreds of old employees with no posting
- no clear KPIs
- tons of old timers who haven't kept up with the current trends and required skills and untrainable. They are happy to just float around, gossips and do nothing
- salary is not the best, but decent
- health benefit is dismal; you have to use company-owned provider first before you go to your regular doctor or hospitals
- a lot of politicking. Watch who you hang out with because he/she can be your ticket to heaven or hell
pros:
- free tickets for you and your immediate family. But you do fly on standby and get be off loaded if the flight is full
- great place to work if you have a side job. You will have a ton of free time to do other things
- decent amount of business travels if you are in the right positions

advice: BUMN must be able to adapt to technological developments and be better able to manage management by carrying out various transformation processes. "The transformation carried out by SOEs should be a reference for Garuda Indonesia to be able to survive from the threat of liquidation. An important question for all of us is, has the mindset or mindset of Garuda Indonesia's internal management people transformed?"
cons: In his presentation, Deputy Minister Tiko explained that the main problem currently being experienced by Garuda is the high level of corporate debt. ... With this condition, the company is in negative equity worth US$ 2.82 billion or equivalent to Rp 40.04 trillion as of September 2021
pros: Garuda Indonesia currently serves more than 60 destinations around the world and various exotic locations in Indonesia. As an airline and for the sake of the best full service flight services, Garuda Indonesia provides the best service through the concept of "Garuda Indonesia Experience" at all touch points of its flight services that adapts the nuances of "Indonesian Hospitality" by presenting hospitality and unique Indonesian cultural richness.

advice:
* Office culture is in deep need of change.
* Assessment for promotion is in deep need of review. Even more, the recruitment itself needs a review since there's still nepotism.
* Employee performance need a total change to avoid subjectivity.
cons:
* Bad middle management: subjective boss, ass-kissing colleagues, assessment hence performance bonus is totally based on the boss's subjectivity.
* Culture: punctuality is a rare commodity, staff literally kisses boss's hands, people talk in meetings so you'd have small meetings in a meeting.
* Employee growth: none, poor quality of internal trainings (one unit even asks the staff to sign a contract prior to a certain training), assessment for promotion is fake since the bosses have 99% of control
pros:
Benefit of flying with a discount rate such as
* You, spouse, up to 3 children: 100% discount (exclude tax) once per year; 90% discount 4 times per year; 50% discount infinitely
* Your parents and your parents-in-law: 90% discount once per year; 50% discount infinitely

advice:
No clear communication from management to the managerial-and-staff level employees. They let rumors spread between employees for weeks before clarification.

No clear data-driven decisions, more like top-down instruction and rumor-based decisions, and don't forget policy can casuistically be changed depends on who the policy is being implemented into.

Honestly, I don't know whether the management even knows where this company is directed to. It feels like they just go with the flow.
cons:
- Average or slightly above average salary especially for non-direct operational units
- Hard communication between units and limited data access
- Uneven workload distribution between team members
- Business uncertainties due to pandemic
pros:
- Annual leave, Special occasion paid leaves (maternity, marriage, grievance, etc), Sick leaves, 
- Mid-year incentives, performance bonus (depends on company and employee performance but hasn't been any in the last 3 years)
- Good health insurance which covers spouse and children
- Discount on company products (ticket, hotels), for employee and close family
summary: Friendly environment, good on non cash benefit

advice: We're all love the company but for some people some better insights already leaving the company, it's your greatest lost in this year's. Please have clearer direction and procedures what to aims in short and long terms. Company need to have the pride and guts to just make sustainable company in the future. Its easier to start from zero than to fix something that already broken. Smaller organization and focusing in your great income. I hope Garuda can get through all the struggles.
cons:
- Non Priority in terms of urgent matter, analysis means analyze but it's just ends up as agenda 
- Too many people especially in management with hidden agenda not for better company future but just for their own benefits
- doesn't have clearly rules about double roles position
pros:
Benefits from working in Airlines
- unlimited discount ticket
- health insurance 
- great colleagues (in the same position)
summary: Love the Company means Love Indonesia

advice:
Reduce the Organizational Structure in head quarters and branch offices.
Remove Fixed Air Crew Flight Allowance, Travel Allowance. These Allowances should be a variable cost not fixed cost.
cons:
Asymmetrical perks and compensation for non-air crew office workers
Air Crew Union are way too involved in management decision and organizational succession
Air Crew with no related previous experiences are assigned without regular assessment to several managerial position in head quarters
Organization are getting bigger, even the airline industry are sunk impacted by covid-19, additional mid-senior managerial positon are positioned in head quarters and branch offices
Career Management are not clear for office workers
Hereditary bad working cultures while cultural transformation are only making pretty new company culture without proper socialization and implementation
pros:
Generous Healthcare Benefit
Free Ticket for your family once a year, unlimited 50% discounted rate ticket
Discounted ticket for Parents and parents in law

cons: I was hoping Garuda Indonesia had more trainings to develop the skills and learnings of their employee, both hard and soft skills.
pros: The best of having an experience working in Garuda Indonesia is that I had the chance to work alongside with many amazing and talented people who are really passionate. We brainstorm ideas, collaborate, and execute the ideas into our actions. I could really say that Garuda Indonesia's best investment is actually their people. Many of their employees have great potentials and will do their best to contribute to the company's growth. Not all of them, of course, but mostly I've met and worked with many inspiring people there and I will cherish the lessons I've gotten to experience and make them my strong core to my next career.

advice: Get more qualified people to manage this company.
cons:
- Very bureaucratic. 
- Getting approval for anything is more difficult than getting through AA's 12 step program I'd imagine. 
- No real KPI, too much micro-managing and inefficient. 
- No career path if you work in one of the international BO (or at least the one I'm working in).
- Major communication problem within departments.
- Procedures seem to change on a whim.
pros:
- Free and discounted tickets are the main perks of this job although don't travel during high season or run the risk of getting off-loaded if the flight's full. 
- The lower ranks seem to work well with each other. 
- Very laid back and good working hours.
